[QLSP-327]  iPOS - CM - Mobile Order Hold Created: 14/Aug/17  Updated: 14/Aug/17

Status: Open
Project: Quality ServicePoint
Component/s: None
Affects Version/s: None
Fix Version/s: None

Type: Test Priority: 3.Medium
Reporter: Grant Parker Assignee: Grant Parker
Resolution: Unresolved Votes: 0
Labels: None
Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original Estimate: Not Specified

Zephyr Teststep:
Test Step Test Data Expected Result
1

Send 5 mobile orders to the lab with out checking them in - This may require submitting one order prior to each test.

Orders are submitted and are now in the Mobile order deferred order queue

2

Sign into an iPOS or POS Next tablet with a Receipt type of Receipt-DT-iPOS

User is signed in
3

Recall one of the orders from the Mobile order queue

The order is recalled and the correct items are on the order
4

Tap the Hold button.

The order is placed on Hold and the hold button displays on the roof bar with a 1.
5

Tap the Hold button on the roof bar. Tap Yes to the prompt to store.

The mobile order is stored in the store recall queue
6

Verify the KPS displays the order correctly with the Mobile Header and correct items. Also Verify that the order is in the recall queue by navigating to Other functions>Recall By transaction number.

The order is displayed correctly and is in the recall queue
7

Recall the next mobile order and place it on hold, Create another normal order and store the order

The mobile held order is stored first then the second order. Confirmable on the KPS and in the recall queue
8

Recall the next Mobile order and place it on hold. Enter and place a standard order on hold. Press the hold button on the roof bar.

Both orders are stored, Mobile order first then Standard order
9

Recall the next Mobile order, Place the order on hold. Attempt to sign out.

Sign out is blocked because there is an order on hold
10

Swipe a manager card on a connected payment terminal.

User sign out is blocked because of the order on hold
11

Recall the last mobile order and place it on hold as well.

There are now two orders on hold
12

Begin and store a standard deferred order.

Storing the deferred order does not store the held orders.
13

Tap the hold button on the roof bar.

Both mobile orders are stored and displayed on the KPS
14

Recall the standard deferred order and place it on hold.

The deferred order is placed on hold.

15

Store a standard order.

The deferred order and standard order are stored.


  Description    

In ServicePoint 2017 R4, iPOS Hold functionality is enhanced by allowing Deferred Orders to be put on Hold and stored in the Store/Recall queue.

In prior ServicePoint releases, Deferred Orders could not be held and stored in this fashion.

Preconditions:
iPOS and Mobile ordering configured for the Lab in use. No additional configuration is needed.

[QLSP-324]  iPOS-Disable cash drawer functionality if receipt printer switch is off Created: 11/Aug/17  Updated: 11/Aug/17

Status: Open
Project: Quality ServicePoint
Component/s: None
Affects Version/s: None
Fix Version/s: None

Type: Test Priority: 3.Medium
Reporter: Grant Parker Assignee: Grant Parker
Resolution: Unresolved Votes: 0
Labels: None
Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original Estimate: Not Specified

Zephyr Teststep:
Test Step Test Data Expected Result
1

Open the iPOS setup page

Page is opened and all settings switches are disabled
2

Attempt to toggle the cash drawer switch

Switch cannot be toggled while print receipts is disabled
3

Toggle Print Receipts on

Print receipts is enabled and the receipt printer is recognized
4

Toggle Use cash drawer on

Cash drawer is enabled
5

Toggle Print Receipts off

Print receipts and cash drawer are both disabled
6

Toggle Print receipts and Use cash drawer back on then sign into iPOS

User is signed in
7

Enter any item and tender the transaction with a cash tender type

Cash drawer is opened and receipt is printed
8

Attempt to begin a transaction without closing the cash drawer

Attempt is blocked by and error message to close the cash drawer
9

Close the cash drawer
10

Attempt to toggle Print receipts off

Attempt is blocked because the cash drawer cannot be toggled while a user is signed in

  Description    

Disable cash drawer functionality if receipt printer switch is off is an enhancement for R4 2017. There is no BRS, therefore, this test is written on knowledge of prior iPOS experience and WIT 423737.

This test case covers the verification of new functionality added for this enhancement, denoted by the f in the title.

WIT Description: Prevent cash drawer functionality if the receipt printer toggle switch under iPOS Setup is turned off. Cash drawer relies on the printer connection for functionality, so without the printer switch on, cash drawer should never work.

  • Functionality to be verified:
  • Disabling the receipt printer disables the switch for cash drawer and disables all functionality for the cash drawer
  • Cash drawer can not be enabled while receipt printer is not enabled
  • Receipt printer can or cannot be disabled/enabled while the user is signed in?
  • Re-enable receipt printer? Does it auto re-enable the cash drawer? The assumption is no.
  • Cash drawer and receipt printer connectivity - Loss of connection, reconnect, pair when enabled,
  • Cash drawer Status updates

Preconditions:
Epson TM88V Paired to the iPad. Cash drawer plugged into the connected receipt printer. All setup switches are disabled.

Any credit card.
1

Must reload on POS as iPOS does not support Gift card activations or reloads

Enter any menu item, Scan a mobile account with pay funds, Store the transaction, Recall and tender on iPOS

Repeat this step and recall on the POS as well.

Transaction is finalized and the receipt is printed with the correct credit information.

Run for one of the card types.

DOC offer is applied, Transaction is finalized and the receipt is printed with the DOC card info and credit card information.
